Protocols/IMCUploadManager.html#/c:objc(.name: -uploadRequestWithScenario:stepFiles:propertyValueContainers:
Protocols/IMCUploadManager.html#/c:objc(.abstract: Creates an IMCRequest that will upload the IMCStepFiles and IMCPropertyValueContainers to the server. Internally it creates a new IMCSession.

Protocols/IMCUploadManager.html#/c:objc(.name: -resumeQueue
Protocols/IMCUploadManager.html#/c:objc(.abstract: Start (or resume) the uploads if there are any pending.

Protocols/IMCZonedDocumentCaptureStep.ht.name: zonedFields
Protocols/IMCZonedDocumentCaptureStep.ht.abstract: An NSArray of IMCZonedField where the data should be extracted from.

Protocols/IMCZonedDocumentCaptureStep.ht.name: allowImportFromDevice
Protocols/IMCZonedDocumentCaptureStep.ht.abstract: Indicates if the user should be able to import an image (instead of capturing) from the device

Protocols/IMCRectangularCaptureStep.html.name: aspectRatio
Protocols/IMCRectangularCaptureStep.html.abstract: The aspect ration of the document that needs to be captured

Protocols/IMCPhotoCaptureStep.html#/c:ob.name: cardinality
Protocols/IMCPhotoCaptureStep.html#/c:ob.abstract: Indicates how many photos the user is allowed to take.

Protocols/IMCPhotoCaptureStep.html#/c:ob.name: allowImportFromDevice
Protocols/IMCPhotoCaptureStep.html#/c:ob.abstract: Indicates if the user should be able to import an image (instead of capturing) from the device

Protocols/IMCStep.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCSte.name: type
Protocols/IMCStep.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCSte.abstract: The step type. You should always work with the typed version of the step (check the rest of the protocols).

Protocols/IMCStep.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCSte.name: files
Protocols/IMCStep.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCSte.abstract: An NSArray of IMCFile. It will be empty until the step is being uploaded. At that point,

Protocols/IMCFile.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCFil.name: fileURL
Protocols/IMCFile.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCFil.abstract: The NSURL where the file is located in the filesystem.

Protocols/IMCFile.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCFil.name: step
Protocols/IMCFile.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCFil.abstract: The IMCStep from which this file was captured/generated.

Protocols/IMCFile.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCFil.name: position
Protocols/IMCFile.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCFil.abstract: The position of the IMCFile for the upload.

Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: sessionId
Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: The session ID. sessionIds are guaranteed to be unique, negative values will be used for sessions which do not have a server counterpart, therefore have no gloabal session id

Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: scenario
Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: The scenario for which the session has been created,

Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: completed
Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: Indicates the status of the session. Once the upload has finished successfully, this property will be true.

Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: state
Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: Indicates the state of the session upload.

Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: files
Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: Contains an NSArray of IMCFile with all the files generated for the scenario. This files will be uploaded to the server.

Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: propertyValueContainers
Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: Contains an NSArray of IMCPropertyValueContainer generated for the scenario. This PropertyValueContainers will be uploaded to the server.

Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: uploadProgress
Protocols/IMCSession.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: Indicates the global progress for the upload.

Protocols/IMCScenario.html#/c:objc(pl)IM.name: title
Protocols/IMCScenario.html#/c:objc(pl)IM.abstract: The title given to the IMCScenario in the admin console.

Protocols/IMCScenario.html#/c:objc(pl)IM.name: steps
Protocols/IMCScenario.html#/c:objc(pl)IM.abstract: An NSArray of IMCStep. Every step should present it’s companion UI and extract data from the captures if needed.

Protocols/IMCScenario.html#/c:objc(pl)IM.name: refreshTimestamp
Protocols/IMCScenario.html#/c:objc(pl)IM.abstract: The last time when the IMCScenario data was refreshed.

Protocols/IMCPersistentRequester.html#/c.name: -clearAllData
Protocols/IMCPersistentRequester.html#/c.abstract: Removes everything that’s stored by the persistent requester.

Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.name: uploadManager
Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.abstract: The IMCUploadManager that should be used to send data from the device to the server.

Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.name: dataProviderManager
Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.abstract: The IMCDataProviderManager that should be used to trigger processing for DataProviderSteps.

Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.name: -scenariosRequest
Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.abstract: Returns an IMCRequest that will contain all the available IMCScenarios.

Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.name: -scenarioRequestWithScenario:
Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.abstract: Returns an IMCRequest that will contain the IMCScenario that matches the IMCScenario passed as a parameter.

Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.name: -scenarioRequestWithScenarioId:
Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.abstract: Returns an IMCRequest that will contain the IMCScenario that matches the id passed as a parameter.

Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.name: -sessionsRequest
Protocols/IMCRequester.html#/c:objc(pl)I.abstract: Returns an IMCRequest that will contain all the available IMCSessions.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: entities
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: The entities that the request has. This will be empty until the data has been downloaded from the server and stored locally.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: -completion:
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: This block is called as soon as the request finishes.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: -progress:
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: This block is called multiple times during the lifetime of the request. The progress is a float ranging from 0 to 1.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: -error:
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: This block is called if the request fails. The error returned will contain the cause of the failure.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: -success:
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: This block is called if the request succeeds.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: -willChange:
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: This block is called before any change happens.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: -inserted:
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: This block is called when an IMCEntity is inserted. The block will contain the inserted IMCEntity and the index where’s been inserted to.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: -deleted:
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: This block is called when an IMCEntity is deleted. The block will contain the deleted IMCEntity and the index where’s been deleted from.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: -moved:
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: This block is called when an IMCEntity is moved. The block will contain the moved IMCEntity and the indexes where’s been moved from and to.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: -updated:
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: This block is called when an IMCEntity is updated. The block will contain the updated IMCEntity and the index where’s been updated.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: -didChange:
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: This block is called after all the changes have happened.

Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.name: -execute
Protocols/IMCRequest.html#/c:objc(pl)IMC.abstract: This method triggers the request. Usually, this means setting up an NSFetchedResultsController in order to notify when there are changes in the model

Protocols/IMCZonedField.html#/c:objc(pl).name: fieldZone
Protocols/IMCZonedField.html#/c:objc(pl).abstract: Indicates the zone where the data should be in a document.

Protocols/IMCField.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCFi.name: editable
Protocols/IMCField.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCFi.abstract: Indicates if the field is editable or not. Usually used in compination of displaying the data in a Property Editor.

Protocols.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCEntity.name: IMCEntity
Protocols.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCEntity.abstract: Base protocol for the data exposed from the SDK.

Protocols/IMCProperty.html.name: IMCProperty
Protocols/IMCProperty.html.abstract: Describes an IMCProperty. An IMCProperty can be shared between steps & fields. It’s unique. It’s used to

Protocols/IMCPropertyValueContainer.html.name: IMCPropertyValueContainer
Protocols/IMCPropertyValueContainer.html.abstract: Relates an IMCPropery with a value contained in an NSString.

Protocols/IMCScenario.html.name: IMCScenario
Protocols/IMCScenario.html.abstract: Describes an IMCScenario created on the admin console.

Protocols/IMCSession.html.name: IMCSession
Protocols/IMCSession.html.abstract: Describes an IMCSession. A session is an object created on the app that will be linked with a session on the server. It will contain the

Protocols/IMCStep.html.name: IMCStep
Protocols/IMCStep.html.abstract: Describes an IMCStep created on the admin console.

Protocols.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCUSDLCapture.name: IMCUSDLCaptureStep
Protocols.html#/c:objc(pl)IMCUSDLCapture.abstract: Describes a United States Drivers License step

Protocols/IMCZone.html.name: IMCZone
Protocols/IMCZone.html.abstract: Describes an IMCZone. The data should be in the rectangle that declares.

Classes/IMCUploadManager.html#/c:objc(cs.name: -initWithNetworkRequestBuilder:modelCoordinator:requester:
Classes/IMCUploadManager.html#/c:objc(cs.abstract: Creates a new IMCUploadManager that will be in charge of uploading the extracted thata to the server.

Classes/IMCStepFile.html#/c:objc(cs)IMCS.name: -initWithStepId:andFileURLs:
Classes/IMCStepFile.html#/c:objc(cs)IMCS.abstract: Creates an IMCStepFile to relate an IMCStep with the captured images. The images should be NSURLs. This relationship is established in memory only,

Classes/IMCRequesterFactory.html#/c:objc.name: +requesterWith:
Classes/IMCRequesterFactory.html#/c:objc.abstract: Initializes an IMCRequester that’s in memory only. If you want to persist the data, use persistentRequesterWith:fileManager:persistenceBaseURL.

Classes/IMCRequesterFactory.html#/c:objc.name: +persistentRequesterWith:fileManager:persistenceBaseURL:
Classes/IMCRequesterFactory.html#/c:objc.abstract: This will create a persistent requester instance, where files are written to the base URL.

Classes/IMCNetworkRequestError.html#/c:o.name: HTTPResponseStatusCode
Classes/IMCNetworkRequestError.html#/c:o.abstract: The HTTP status code returned by the server. 0 if the server didn’t respond.

Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.name: baseURL
Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.abstract: The URL from where all the enpoints will be called.

Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.name: authenticated
Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.abstract: Returns true if the username+password are saved. False otherwise. True doesn’t mean that the user is authenticated against the server.

Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.name: sessionStateChanged
Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.abstract: Called when the session state changes. The new value is what you should store to later on recreate this object with this sessionState.

Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.name: networkRequester
Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.abstract: The IMCNetworkRequester used to perform network calls to the API.

Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.name: fileUploadNetworkRequester
Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.abstract: The IMCNetworkRequester used to upload files. It’s different from the regular networkRequester because the fileUploadNetworkRequester doesn’t include any headers

Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.name: -initWithBaseURL:accessId:accessSecretKey:
Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.abstract: Create a new instance of this object.

Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.name: -initWithBaseURL:accessId:accessSecretKey:sessionState:
Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.abstract: Create a new instance of this object.

Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.name: -authenticateWithCredential:completion:
Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.abstract: Authenticate agains the server. If the operation succeeds, the sessionState returned should be saved and used to recreate this object later on to avoid having to input again the user credentials.

Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.name: -deauthenticate
Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.abstract: Logout the user. Remove the in memory stored data related to the credentials + call the server to invalidate the token.

Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.name: -invalidate
Classes/IMCNetworkRequestBuilder.html#/c.abstract: Invalidates the URLSession used for the IMCNetworkRequester. After calling this, you should not perform any more ntwork calls, if URLSession has been

Classes/IMCDataProviderManager.html#/c:o.name: pollingInterval
Classes/IMCDataProviderManager.html#/c:o.abstract: The amount of seconds between every polling call. Defaults to 5 seconds.

Classes/IMCDataProviderManager.html#/c:o.name: maxRetries
Classes/IMCDataProviderManager.html#/c:o.abstract: The maximum number of retries for the poll. Defaults to 10 times.

Classes/IMCDataProviderManager.html#/c:o.name: -processSession:forScenario:atStep:withPropertyContainers:completion:
Classes/IMCDataProviderManager.html#/c:o.abstract: Returns a session that will be local only at the beggining but later on it will be updated with a remote one.

Type%20Definitions.html.name: Type Definitions
Type%20Definitions.html.abstract: The following type definitions are available globally.
